com.mobixell.xtt
Class FunctionModule_IMAP

java.lang.Object
  com.mobixell.xtt.FunctionModule
      com.mobixell.xtt.FunctionModule_IMAP
All Implemented Interfaces:
Comparable<Object>
public class FunctionModule_IMAP
extends FunctionModule

FunctionModule_IMAP provides HTTP and HTTPS GET functions.

Version:
$Id: FunctionModule_IMAP.java,v 1.1 2010/05/14 13:02:09 awadhai Exp $
Author:
Anil Wadhai

startIMAPServer

public boolean startIMAPServer(String[] parameters)
starts the IMAPServer as an instance of IMAPServer.

Parameters:
parameters - array of String containing the parameters. parameters[0] argument is always the method name, parameters[1] argument is the IMAPServer port, parameters[2] is the IMAPServer hostName, parameters[3] argument is the number of IMAPServer threads, parameters[4] argument is the IMAPServer timeout. If only parameters[0] is submitted the parameters will be taken from the configuration xml document in XTTProperties. If null is used as parameters it sends the allowed parameters list to the XTTProperties.printFail(java.lang.String) method and returns.
See Also:
IMAPServer, IMAPWorker, XTTProperties

stopIMAPServer

public boolean stopIMAPServer(String[] parameters)
stops the SMTPServer and all it's threads.

Parameters:
parameters - array of String containing the parameters. parameters[0] argument is always the method name, no additional parameters are requeired. If null is used as parameters it sends the allowed parameters list to the XTTProperties.printFail(java.lang.String) method and returns.
See Also:
SMTPServer.stopGracefully()

public void sendCAPABILITY(String[] parameters)
The CAPABILITY command requests a listing of capabilities that the server supports. details available athttp://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3501#page-24 parameters[0] argument is always the method name If null is used as parameters it sends the allowed parameters list to the XTTProperties.printFail(java.lang.String) method and returns.

parameters -

sendNOOP

public void sendNOOP(String[] parameters)
The NOOP command always succeeds. It does nothing. The NOOP command can also be used to reset any inactivity autologout timer on the server. parameters[0] argument is always the method name If null is used as parameters it sends the allowed parameters list to the XTTProperties.printFail(java.lang.String) method and returns.

Parameters:
parameters -

sendLOGOUT

public void sendLOGOUT(String[] parameters)
The LOGOUT command informs the server that the client is done with the connection. The server MUST send a BYE untagged response before the (tagged) OK response, and then close the network connection. parameters[0] argument is always the method name If null is used as parameters it sends the allowed parameters list to the XTTProperties.printFail(java.lang.String) method and returns.

Parameters:
parameters -

public void sendSTARTTLS(String[] parameters)
The STARTTLS command is an alternate form of establishing session privacy protection and integrity checking, but does not establish authentication or enter the authenticated state. parameters[0] argument is always the method name If null is used as parameters it sends the allowed parameters list to the XTTProperties.printFail(java.lang.String) method and returns.

sendLIST

public void sendLIST(String[] parameters)
parameters[0] argument is always the method name parameters[1] argument is reference name An empty ("" string) reference name argument indicates that the mailbox name is interpreted as by SELECT. parameters[2] argument is mailbox name with possible wildcards If null is used as parameters it sends the allowed parameters list to the XTTProperties.printFail(java.lang.String) method and returns.

Parameters:
parameters -

sendLSUB

public void sendLSUB(String[] parameters)
The LSUB command returns a subset of names from the set of names that the user has declared as being "active" or "subscribed". Zero or more untagged LSUB replies are returned parameters[0] argument is always the method name parameters[1] argument is reference name An empty ("" string) reference name argument indicates that the mailbox name is interpreted as by SELECT. parameters[2] argument is mailbox name with possible wildcards If null is used as parameters it sends the allowed parameters list to the XTTProperties.printFail(java.lang.String) method and returns.

Parameters:
parameters -

sendSUBSCRIBE

public void sendSUBSCRIBE(String[] parameters)
The SUBSCRIBE command adds the specified mailbox name to the server's set of "active" or "subscribed" mailboxes as returned by the LSUB command. parameters[0] argument is always the method name parameters[1] argument is mailbox_name If null is used as parameters it sends the allowed parameters list to the XTTProperties.printFail(java.lang.String) method and returns.

sendUNSUBSCRIBE

public void sendUNSUBSCRIBE(String[] parameters)
The UNSUBSCRIBE command removes the specified mailbox name from the server's set of "active" or "subscribed" mailboxes as returned by the LSUB command. parameters[0] argument is always the method name parameters[1] argument is mailbox_name If null is used as parameters it sends the allowed parameters list to the XTTProperties.printFail(java.lang.String) method and returns.

sendCHECK

public void sendCHECK(String[] parameters)
The CHECK command requests a checkpoint of the currently selected mailbox. A checkpoint refers to any implementation-dependent housekeeping associated with the mailbox parameters[0] argument is always the method name If null is used as parameters it sends the allowed parameters list to the XTTProperties.printFail(java.lang.String) method and returns.

Parameters:
parameters -

sendCLOSE

public void sendCLOSE(String[] parameters)
The CLOSE command permanently removes all messages that have the \Deleted flag set from the currently selected mailbox. parameters[0] argument is always the method name If null is used as parameters it sends the allowed parameters list to the XTTProperties.printFail(java.lang.String) method and returns.

Parameters:
parameters -

sendEXPUNGE

public void sendEXPUNGE(String[] parameters)
The EXPUNGE command permanently removes all messages that have the \Deleted flag set from the currently selected mailbox. Before returning an OK to the client, an untagged EXPUNGE response is sent for each message that is removed. parameters[0] argument is always the method name If null is used as parameters it sends the allowed parameters list to the XTTProperties.printFail(java.lang.String) method and returns.

Parameters:
parameters -

sendSTATUS

public void sendSTATUS(String[] parameters)
This command return some basic information on the folder without selecting the folder, it takes arguments depending on what information you would like returned. parameters[0] argument is always the method name parameters[1] argument is folder name parameters[2] argument is status parenthesized list e.g (messages),(recent), (unseen) C: A001 STATUS INBOX (messages) If null is used as parameters it sends the allowed parameters list to the XTTProperties.printFail(java.lang.String) method and returns.

Parameters:
parameters -

sendAPPEND

public void sendAPPEND(String[] parameters)
The APPEND command appends the literal argument as a new message to the end of the specified destination mailbox. parameters[0] argument is always the method name parameters[1] argument is mailbox name parameters[2] argument is OPTIONAL flag parenthesized list parameters[3] argument is OPTIONAL date/time string parameters[4] argument is message literal If null is used as parameters it sends the allowed parameters list to the XTTProperties.printFail(java.lang.String) method and returns.

Parameters:
parameters -

sendSEARCH

public void sendSEARCH(String[] parameters)
parameters[0] argument is always the method name parameters[1] argument is OPTIONAL [CHARSET] specification e.g CHARSET UTF-8 parameters[2] argument is searching criteria (one or more) if argument > 1 then it should seprated by SPACE, for more details please refer http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3501#page-49 If null is used as parameters it sends the allowed parameters list to the XTTProperties.printFail(java.lang.String) method and returns.

Parameters:
parameters -

sendFETCH

public void sendFETCH(String[] parameters)
The FETCH command retrieves data associated with a message in the mailbox. The data items to be fetched can be either a single atom or a parenthesized list parameters[0] argument is always the method name parameters[1] argument is sequence set parameters[2] argument is message data item names or macro If null is used as parameters it sends the allowed parameters list to the XTTProperties.printFail(java.lang.String) method and returns.

Parameters:
parameters -

sendSTORE

public void sendSTORE(String[] parameters)
The STORE command alters data associated with a message in the mailbox. parameters[0] argument is always the method name parameters[1] argument is sequence set parameters[2] argument is message data item names parameters[3] argument is value for message data item If null is used as parameters it sends the allowed parameters list to the XTTProperties.printFail(java.lang.String) method and returns.

parameters -

sendSETQUOTA

public void sendSETQUOTA(String[] parameters)
The SETQUOTA command takes the name of a mailbox quota root and a list of resource limits. The resource limits for the named quota root are changed to be the specified limits. Any previous resource limits for the named quota root are discarded. parameters[0] argument is always the method name parameters[1] argument is quota_root(mailboxName) parameters[2] argument is resource_limits If null is used as parameters it sends the allowed parameters list to the XTTProperties.printFail(java.lang.String) method and returns.

Parameters:
parameters -

sendGETQUOTA

public void sendGETQUOTA(String[] parameters)
The GETQUOTA command takes the name of a quota root and returns the quota root's resource usage and limits in an untagged QUOTA response. parameters[0] argument is always the method name parameters[1] argument is quota_root(mailboxName) If null is used as parameters it sends the allowed parameters list to the XTTProperties.printFail(java.lang.String) method and returns.

Parameters:
parameters -

sendGETQUOTAROOT

public void sendGETQUOTAROOT(String[] parameters)
The GETQUOTAROOT command takes the name of a mailbox and returns the list of quota roots for the mailbox in an untagged QUOTAROOT response. For each listed quota root, it also returns the quota root's resource usage and limits in an untagged QUOTA response. parameters[0] argument is always the method name parameters[1] argument is mailboxName. If null is used as parameters it sends the allowed parameters list to the XTTProperties.printFail(java.lang.String) method and returns.

Parameters:
parameters -
